intro: Mentha montana, commonly known as alpine mint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Mentha montana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
